articles.title: A Perplexing JavaScript Parsing Puzzle
articles.description: It looks deceptively simple ‚Äì just 14 characters of JavaScript ‚Äì but after working with JavaScript for 29 years, I got it wrong. A clue: it goes back to a browser-related quirk from 30 years ago..
articles.author: Hillel Wayne

articles.title: TypeScript's Compiler to Get 10x Faster
articles.description: TypeScript has shaken up the JavaScript ecosystem in recent years with an increasing number of developers relying on its strong typing and added structure. TypeScript‚Äôs compiler isn‚Äôt particularly fast, though, but the TypeScript team at Microsoft are changing that by porting it to Go!
articles.author: Anders Hejlsberg (Microsoft)

articles.title: Building APIs with Next.js
articles.description: A detailed, official introduction to the concepts behind using Next.js‚Äô App Router and route handlers to build public APIs you can expose to web, mobile, and third-party clients.
articles.author: Lee Robinson

articles.title: How The New York Times Migrated from Enzyme to React Testing¬†Library
articles.description: A thorough look at the technical challenges and strategies the NYT used to perform a piecemeal upgrade of its React testing approach without disrupting either end users or other developers.
articles.author: Felipe Buena√±o (NYT Open Team)

articles.title: How ECMAScript Engines Optimize Your Variables
articles.description: From the authors of the Boa JS Rust-powered JavaScript engine.
articles.author: Boa Developers

articles.title: Refractor 5.0: Robust Virtual Syntax Highlighting using Prism
articles.description: Wraps the powerful Prism syntax highlighter to output objects instead of an HTML string so you can manipulate and render it as you wish (e.g. in a VDOM or at the terminal). Lowlight, by the same author, offers the same functionality but backed by highlight.js.
articles.author: Titus Wormer

articles.title: svg2pdf.js: SVG to PDF Conversion in the Browser
articles.description: There‚Äôs an online playground to give you a feel for what it can do.
articles.author: yWorks GmbH

articles.title: ‚åòK: A Fast, Composable, Unstyled 'Command Menu' Control
articles.description: The home page includes some neat examples in a variety of styles. GitHub repo. Needs React 18+.
articles.author: Paco Coursey

articles.title: üîé¬†Node Modules Inspector
articles.description: A tool that runs pnpm inside your browser, ‚Äúinstalls‚Äù a package, then analyzes its dependencies. This can be useful for analyzing packages you already use, but also for simplifying your own projects, as 11ty‚Äôs Zach Leatherman did here.
articles.author: Anthony Fu

articles.title: PGlite: Run Postgres in WebAssembly
articles.description: PGlite packages a WASM build of Postgres into a TypeScript library that can be run directly from Node.js (or Bun, Deno, and even the browser) and it‚Äôs only a few megabytes in size.
articles.author: ElectricSQL / Neon

articles.description: Node.js v20.19.0 (LTS) is a notable release for a maintenance branch of Node as an exception has been made to the maintenance policy for backporting require(esm) support, which is now enabled by default.

The latest version of Chrome (and preview versions of Firefox and Safari) support two new HTML attributes, command and commandfor, for adding declarative actions to HTML buttons without directly requiring JavaScript.
Nuxt 3.16 ‚Äì Popular Vue meta-framework. Now with a new create-nuxt tool for starting projects.
Bun 1.2.5 ‚Äì Now with much better Node-API compatibility, CSRF generation and verification, plus numerous perf improvements and fixes.
Melange 5 ‚Äì An OCaml-to-JavaScript compiler.
Astro 5.5, Transformers.js 3.4, Capacitor 7.1, Nuxt UI v3

articles.title: CSS Relative Colors
articles.description: Another excellent guide from Ahmad exploring the syntax behind CSS relative color. This comprehensive, interactive explainer shares how we can now dynamically generate and modify colors based on existing ones directly in CSS (without the need of a pre-processor). Looks at practical use cases, fallbacks, contrast ratio, and more.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: Cool Native HTML Elements You Should Already Be Using
articles.description: Even experienced developers can be dazzled by all the new things added to HTML over the years. Harrison helps you catch up with any blind spots here with a look at numerous lesser-used options.
articles.author: Harrison Broadbent

articles.title: Delaying the Shipping of CSS @function From Chrome 136 to¬†139
articles.description: A few issues ago we shared how there were some concerns regarding the intent to ship CSS @function support in Chrome. Well, now the Chrome team have announced a delay (until Chrome 139) due to some ‚Äúrecent impactful spec changes‚Äù resulting in a need for some more experimentation time.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: Prompt Engineering for Web Development
articles.description: Kevin has been tinkering with code generation for a couple of years now, and here he shares some of the approaches and techniques that he‚Äôs found to be particularly beneficial while generating PHP, SASS, JS, and HTML code.
articles.author: Kevin Leary

articles.title: Dive Into WebGPU
articles.description: If you‚Äôre curious about creating modern 3D graphics in the browser then this is a good place to start. It offers a well-structured multi-part guide to setting up and creating a landing page complete with various animated 3D WebGPU scenes. Caveat being that WebGPU support is something of a mixed bag at the moment.
articles.author: Martin Laxenaire

articles.title: How to Make Web Videos Way Smaller in 2025 with AV1
articles.description: Here‚Äôs how the AV1 codec can be used to make videos on your site both smaller and better quality. Includes CLI instructions and some cross-browser tricks.
articles.author: Andrey Sitnik

articles.title: Super 'Crispy' SVG Icons
articles.description: This is a solid and meticulous look at the various design considerations and techniques that go into creating clear, purposeful SVG icongraphy ‚Äî think size, style, paths, optimizations, etc.
articles.author: Alex Duncan

articles.title: View Transitions Applied: Smoothly Animating a border-radius with a View Transition
articles.description: Bramus shows us how to smoothly animate properties like border-radius during View Transitions. There‚Äôs also a related video talk if you want to get up to speed on all things View Transitions.
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme

articles.title: Grouping¬†Selection¬†List¬†Items Together¬†with¬†CSS¬†Grid
articles.description: CSS Grid can be used to visually group selected items in a list. Preethi presents two methods to do just that here ‚Äî resulting in a nice UI win.
articles.author: Preethi Sam

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†New in Chrome Q1 2025: CSS text-box, File System Access for Android, Baseline Updates and More
articles.description: A round-up of recent changes and additions to Chrome.
articles.author: Mariko Kosaka

articles.title: Usability Testing with Disabled Users is a Good Investment
articles.description: ‚Ä¶and will highlight accessibility barriers missed in typical accessibility audits.
articles.author: Nicolas Steenhout

articles.title: code-inspector: Click a Page Element to View Its Source Code
articles.description: Once installed, use ALT+SHIFT to position your cursor at that location in the code in your IDE. Supports a number of tools and frameworks (React, Vue, Webpack, etc) along with 10+ IDEs.
articles.author: zhoulixiang

articles.title: Filter: A Powerful, Web-Based Image Editor for Quick Image Edits and Filters
articles.description: A tool from Addy Osmani that you can install and configure locally. It‚Äôs optimized for mobile use and the processing is all done locally.
articles.author: Addy Osmani

articles.title: MotifyX: A Curated Collection of Modern, Customizable CSS Backgrounds
articles.description: You can choose from six categories of background types (geometric, futuristic, gradients, etc., some of which are animated) and each can be previewed on the page and edited as needed.
articles.author: Jatin Yadav

articles.title: I18n Code: Translate JSON Files and Blog Posts Into Multiple Languages
articles.description: Enter your content in valid JSON or Markdown format to generate a translated version (maintaining keys in English). Supports 25+ languages. Useful for static sites that require translation.
articles.author: I18n Code

articles.title: Super Color Palette: A Color Palette Generator for Shifting Hue, Saturation, Lightness, and More
articles.description: Lots to fiddle around with here but the main feature is the set of sliders that let you easily ‚Äòadjust‚Äô the palette using HSL. Also includes tools for generating palettes, accessibility, etc.
articles.author: Super Color Palette

articles.title: Chrome Extension Boilerplate: Create Chrome/Firefox Extensions using React and Typescript
articles.description: Boasts faster build speeds and an improved development experience through use of Vite and Turborepo.
articles.author: JongHak Seo
